content: amsterdam scarf by dana fehrenbach this asymmetrical scarf will take out the chill of the day based on the stitch in my amsterdam cowl pattern it comes in two sizes a petite wrap which makes a perfect little scarf or a larger size which gives more coverage like a shawl the pattern can be reversible once you master the look of the wrap you will make as many as possible to gift to that special person you love to knit for here are some ways to adapt this pattern 1 use a contrast color or a coordinating mohair/silk yarn on row 6 of the set up and on row 1 of the main body then on row 16 and row 1 of subsequent repeats in final section use contrast on row 1 8 and 9 2 in the final section on row 3 bead the center stitch of the three purls then in row 5 you can place a bead after you have finished the s2kp stitch the beads should alternate each other and compliment the final section small shown in bronze finished dimensions needles small 22 x 47 after blocking us size 4 circular any length that large 32 x 64 comfortably holds all your stitches yarn baah yarn la jolla 100% notions superwash merino wool stitch marker 400 yards/ 115 grams tapestry needle 1 skein for small shown in gauge after blocking bronze 21 sts and 26 row per 4 /10 cm in lace pattern 2 skeins for large shown in toad you so gauge is not critical for this project but will affect final size drape and
